comment: I took her Research Methods class and got an A in it. The class seems difficult due to the lack of clarity in instruction and absence of application, but it really isn't. Put some effort into the 8 homework assignments, use key-words from the powerpoints in your paper, and look over the last 3 homework assignments/in-class handouts for the final.

She is not difficult to understand and does help a lot. She has given NO information on what our final will be over. It's VERY frustrating as we have a final that gives the majority of our grade and have no information on it. She gives assignments that you MUST complete on-site, which is a challenge. Also, a project is due, which we have no info on
Well to me she is very easy to understand and very helpful. Not easy class, but it's a masters program
She is a great and very intelligent person. However, she is hard to understand and the subject of the class is not an easy one to teach.

Do not take Choi. For my class we actually only spent 3 weeks in the class. The class was extremely easy, but I felt bad for those who didn't understand things. She speaks horrible English, and she will not clarify answers to any questions. I received a B in her class, because she has a jacked way of grading. Avoid her, she's dumb.

This professor is NOT easy to understand at all. She acts like she cannot understand English! She grades really easy but makes the assignments so hard it takes at least 3 hours to get through. She is NOT receptive to student's questions. She asks if you understand and when you say "No" she looks at you like you're crazy.

Horrible class. She has a very thick Korean accent (which you cannot understand. She lectures everyday for the ENTIRE class time. Sits in front of a computer, speaks very low and monotone. If you raise a question, she gives you the death stare. She is very dry, boring, and rude. Tests are extremely hard, and you never know what will be on there.
